author: peterbisma
title: Cardano DApp for Rent
description: Difficulty in finding accommodation/apartments/flats for rent in Ghana.

f6_assessments.q0: I like the idea of this proposal and believe it addresses an appropriate problem in the appropriate challenge.  The proposer presents a detailed problem with market specific examples, as well as a thoughtful and well structured way to pursue a solution, using Cardano as a backbone for that solution.  Further, I believe this scope of this problem is wider than just Ghana, and challenge the author to think about scalability solutions as they build, so that impact maybe expanded new markets if this technology is successful at addressing the problem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal does a great job of showing transparency among the project collaborators, resources, development repository, and partnerships planned for the implementation phase of this project.  The timeline is well thought out, with a realistic trial phase rollout planned to test early phase Dapp before expansion to a wider market.  The budget is distributed fairly, I might even venture to say low considering the 9-12 month timeline for Dapp launch with only $3000 USD budgeted for the management team.  The only reason why I agree vs agree strongly on this proposal in fact is because I think the budget may be a bit too conservative/modest, and I hope the proposal team will consider a follow-up, or alternative bridge financing to keep the project moving foward if in case they experience some traction but start running short on cash to deliver a final product to address their market.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has embraced the proper tools (github) for openness and transparency, and are planning to engage other community building tools to funnel conversation into an open and transparent resource for tracking progress and responding to feedback form their relevant market.  I love this idea, and wish the team the best success in this venture.  Will also be on the lookout for future rounds on Catalyst!

f6_assessments.q1:
In regards to the proposed team and the experience team members, I have confidence that they have what it takes to do what they say they will do as mentioned in the plan here. Cardano DApp for Rent will focuses on establishing a registry for property owners in Ghana in the long term. However, they seek funding for the first 3 months to do research to ensure the development of an accessible DApp and mitigate the rent challenges faced by owners and customers. . DApp dedicated to the housing industry in Ghana. DApp specificity will make deployment easy.
The success of the proposal will support future funding for the development. Their team has a researcher with experience in Plutus development, ATALAPrism and also welcomes the partnership for great scalability in Ghana. A focus on research for DApps would be helpful to identify operational challenges and outline measures to overcome these challenges in the face of project development.
f6_assessments.q2: Cardano DApp for Rent will log activities for auditability. DApp developers will use github to enable openness and transparency in development. Catalyst members will be provided with progress reports on the discord channel. The DApp Research Guide will help include localization in Dapp design and development and ensure stakeholder engagement. This will make it easier to track project activities. The suggested metrics are very good indicators. They are specific, real, and can be measured to track successful progress.

f6_assessments.q0: The identified problem statement provided by the proposer is short and concise, and is supported with  the necessary data to back this assumption. The challenge of “difficulty in finding accommodation/apartments/flats for rent in Ghana” highlights the 2.4 million housing deficit in the country and the estimated number of people (1400) house hunting daily. This concretizes the problem, not reducing it to mere speculations or possibly personal accounts or experience of  a small minority. The problem statement also makes mention of the risks that house hunting in Ghana poses to people; long travel dangers, liable to imposters and fraudulent activities and high agent fees.  The Cardano Dapp for rent proposes to utilise Cardano smart contract and a platform for user registry, verification and authentication process, and payments using the Cardano ADA. According to the proposer, the Cardano Dapp for rent is a platform designed to provide an enlisting of available homes to prospective renters/buyers, providing quality experiences and cost reductions. However, the Dapp for rent desire to gain user trust using educational advertising,  transparency and success stories is very unrealistic because it fails to mention how to address individual user experiences when using the app and other methods of conversion to retain users and drive company success.
f6_assessments.q1: Looking at the prospects of the Cardano Dapp for rent, and over a decade-long experience of the team, the proposal is likely to be implemented successfully. Details provided in the proposal informs that the team researcher is skilled in Plutus development and ATALAPrism to drive the first quarter of the research process. Aside from team strength, the members of the project are open to collaborations and onboarding with SMEs to scale the business. In the proposal, the stated mission of the team is to provide a registry for homeowners and landlords, however securing funds from Cardano for first quarter research to strategize and mitigate identified challenges would drastically affect the success of the implementation process. Implementation of the project limits its operations to the Ghanaian rent ecosystem to ensure focus and control market success. Looking at the budget breakdown for the project, further detailing on how the research would be conducted could have improved the transparency and direction of  the first phase.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal contains some methods of tracking; Github, progress reports and a research guide between team members, stakeholders and catalyst members to maintain transparency in the project development. The proposal however lacks the necessary KPIs to measure the success of the first project implementation. Although the objective of the project is clear, i.e a platform to host homeowners and renters, it lacks vision and an end-goal to measure the continual success of the Cardano Dapp for rent project.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seems to fit perfectly to the National Building Apps challenge, as a DApp will be created to help eliminate fraudsters, middlemen charging exorbitant fees which make renting more expensive in Ghana. By doing so, it will lead to cost reduction, reduce scammers and build trust between homeowners and the people who rent in the renting and accommodation ecosystem; then bring financial advantages to the community. I believe that the impact of this project will serve as the pilot and will lay the groundwork to begin building a base for the future.
f6_assessments.q1: The team describes the qualification and experiences of each member of the team, each of whom has considerable experience and achievements. The implementation plan is straightforward, and all steps that the team intends to take are all sensible and understandable. Since the team only requested funding for the first phase of the project including the research phase, I think that the budget breakdown is very detailed and logical. The team experience accumulated by the team gives me confidence that this first phase will be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: Mentioning auditability, I think that the team has provided enough information. Four big major elements of each phase have been clearly outlined in the timeline. Each section outlines the deliverables that the team plans to achieve. They also use github and discord channel and record the activities of the project so that the community can monitor the progress easier.

f6_assessments.q0: Recognizing Ghana's present housing crisis, the proposer devised a plan that might very possibly address it. The incorporation of Cardano DApp Rent into the process ensures that buyers, vendors, and renters will transact directly with each other to prevent fraud or intermediary costs. To reduce misunderstanding at the initial usage, Proposer additionally offers tutorials for users. Despite the fact that one difficulty was stated, and I am satisfied with how they handled it, I would want to add a few additional challenges that may arise in the future. For example, how do they prevent fake real estate owners from profiting from the program, or how do they ensure that consumers' personal information is not disclosed to other parties? Also, if they can add some positive influence on Cardano, the proposal will be more perfect. For example, not only does this expand Cardano's market to Ghana, but it also quickly transforms Cardano into a community with a greatly increased degree of trust. If they can address these issues, the project's future functioning will be more convenient, in my opinion.
f6_assessments.q1: As far as I can see, the proposer has done a good job of preparing for this idea. The dates for completing the activities are also explicitly indicated, as are the expenditures. I appreciate how they reinforced the project's purpose and features once again, giving investors a good summary of the idea. People in the working team have also worked for many years in the research, programming, or commercial industries. However, I would want to make a minor suggestion. If choosing the Ghanaian or someone who has experience living here, the proposer will understand user psychology and easily conduct seminars and user research.
f6_assessments.q2: In this part, I have not yet noticed much advancement or development of the project. Moreover, I absolutely agree with the proposer's accomplishments. However, the proposer should once again demonstrate what the Cardano ecosystem will gain if the initiative is successful in the future. It might be fame, or it could be an increase in users.

f6_assessments.q0: I agree that the proposal addresses the challenge effectively. I think it's a good idea to use a DApp to create an authentic registry for property owners to enable easy search and rent in Ghana. Because Finding a room is really a difficult and time-consuming process for newcomers to the city. Not only is it difficult to find, but choosing a good, safe and affordable hostel also makes many people a headache. However, with the growing technology of today, I think that it is completely easy to handle such situations with DApp. I strongly agree that creating a DApp eliminates scammers, middlemen (3rd parties) charging exorbitant fees that make rent in Ghana more expensive. This proposal to build a DApp is really useful in the Cardano ecosystem, especially this project also uses smart contracts, which is also one of the projects in the ecosystem. Smart contracts also help us save travel costs, ensure transactions are done quickly and accurately, and also have high security. Therefore, I support this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
In my opinion, the proposal is closer to identifying and working around a business opportunity in the real state sector rather than key aspects of the Nation Building Dapps challenge such as poverty or foundational registration.   Things like the creation of a landowner registry seems to be a solution to a logistical problem and not a contribution to the reduction of poverty indicators or to the legitimization of land ownership rights. 

Putting the situation in context, if we look at the proposal through the eyes of the UN Sustainable Development Goals, we can see its lack of focus on objectives such as the End of Poverty or Sustainable Cities and Communities.  But, don't get me wrong, as a commercial and business opportunity, the proposal has its merits.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal is a project of 12 months of duration. The first 3 months, destination of the funds requested, will be dedicated to research. According to the Timeline and the Budget Breakdown of the proposal, the research will be focus in the Dapp design and not in the fundamentals of the Real State market in Ghana (However, let's say the proponents have a whole body of data and knowledge about the Real State business in Ghana).  The proposal states: "research to ensuring the development of a DApp that would be accessible and mitigate rent challenges faced by property owners and customers". The budget specifies the following research activities:  Design Research, Mobile Development Research, Plutus Development Research, AtalaPRISM Development Research, Team Fees. The following questions arise in my mind 1) what is the specific purpose of each of these sub-researches?  Specifically, what the proponents are looking for? 2) how will the results of one sub-research affect the next sub-research? 3) how will the results of that general phase of the investigation (the first 3 months) affect the next steps of the proposal?, because it is well known that research has the bad habit of disrupting initial assumptions. 

In al case, the information provided by the Feasability section confirms the market profile of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The section "Please describe how you will measure the progress and the development of the project?" does not provided specific KPIs for measurement purposes. Therefore, the KPIs do not provide quantitative data that can be audited. At the end of the pipe, the water does not flow consistently.  

For the other hand, the section "What does success for this project look like?" is a continuation of the Feasability section.
